citation.article-title: New types of the acetate-oxidizing, sulfate-reducing Desulfobacter species, D. hydrogenophilus sp. nov., D. latus sp. nov., and D. curvatus sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Desulfobacter curvatus sp. nov.
Desulfobacter curvatus (cur.va'tus. L. part. curvatus curved, bent)
Acetate and ethanol are used as electron donors and carbon sources.
The G + C content of the DNA is 46 mol%.
Biotin, and at least 0.7 NaCl and 0.13 g MgCl2⋄H2O are required.
Type strain has been isolated from marine sediment, however, vibrio-shaped acetate-oxidizing sulfate reducers may be also found in freshwater sediments.
Type strain: AcRM3, DSM number 3379, deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen, FRG.
